meanings.definition: The behavior or attitudes of a conformist or materialistic person.
meanings.sent1: In the small town, everyone's babbitry was evident in their desire for the latest gadgets.
meanings.sent2: Her babbitry was clear in her obsession with brand names and expensive cars.
meanings.sent3: John's babbitry reached new heights when he insisted on buying the same car as all his neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The babbitry of society was like a heavy cloud, stifling individuality and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The babbitry of the town was so strong that even the children were focused on material possessions.

meanings.definition: The practice of conforming to conventional, middle-class values.
meanings.sent1: She found herself caught up in babbitry when she started caring more about appearances than personal values.
meanings.sent2: Babbitry often leads people to prioritize wealth and status over personal growth.
meanings.sent3: The babbitry of the neighborhood was so extreme that even the pets seemed to compete for the fanciest accessories.
meanings.sent4: The babbitry of the community was like a maze, trapping individuals in a cycle of consumerism.
meanings.sent5: The babbitry of the town was like a contagious disease, spreading conformity wherever it went.
